title: Principle of Two Weaknesses | Naiditsch vs Svidler || Grenke Chess Classic (2019)
description:
Interview with Svidler here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nPDFdir0Eg8

Round 2 Impressions here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90kp5rMrSeY&fbclid=IwAR1ikUEVdGS8SRa9sSvour2dTH8RtvwL8q2Svh5u180jsziYnfQSUZFJgkY

Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Arkadij Naiditsch vs Peter Svidler
GRENKE Chess Classic (2019), Karlsruhe GER, rd 2, Apr-21 
Spanish Game: Exchange. Normal Variation (C69)

1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bc6 dc6 5. O-O Qf6 6. d4 ed4 7. Bg5 Qd6 8. Nd4 Be7 9. Be7 Ne7 10. Nc3 Bd7 11. Nde2 O-O-O 12. Qc1 Ng6 13. Qe3 Kb8 14. Rad1 Qe7 15. f4 Bc8 16. Nc1 Rd1 17. Rd1 b6 18. Nd3 a5 19. Re1 Ba6 20. Nf2 Re8 21. a3 f6 22. Ne2 Bb7 23. Ng3 c5 24. Nf5 Qf7 25. Rd1 Nf8 26. c3 a4 27. h3 Ne6 28. Ng3 Bc6 29. Rd2 Nd8 30. Qd3 Nb7 31. Kh2 Nd6 32. Rd1 h5 33. Re1 h4 34. Nf1 Qb3 35. e5 fe5 36. fe5 Qb2 37. Re2 Qb5 38. Qc2 Nc4 39. e6 Na3

The 2019 GRENKE Chess Classic is a 10-player round-robin held in Germany from 22-29 April. The first 3 rounds are in Karlsruhe alongside the GRENKE Chess Open, then after two additional rounds in Karlsruhe and a rest day the last 4 rounds are in the Kulturhaus LA8 in Baden-Baden. The field features World Champion Magnus Carlsen and fellow Top 10 players Fabiano Caruana, Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, Vishy Anand and Levon Aronian.

The time control is 100 minutes for 40 moves, then 50 minutes for 20 moves and then 15 minutes to the end of the game, with a 30-second increment from move 1. If players are tied for first place a rapid play-off will take place. Official website: www.grenkechessclassic.com
